block1.title: Back to School Kids Kovid Booster Cocktail

p.li: As children return to in-person schooling every year, most parents are usually prepared for their kids’ immune system to put up with a few weeks of colds and other transmissible illnesses.

This year, the list of illnesses gets even longer due to the deadly Covid-19 pandemic which comes with symptoms that can mimic other illnesses. As children head to school now, Covid-19 cases keep rising and children under the age of 12 cannot be vaccinated against the novel virus, leaving parents with fewer options.

block2.title: Immune Booster Shots – Safety considerations for your child
block2.p: Research has shown that a well-functioning immune system strengthened by lifestyle habits such as

ul.li: a diet high in fruits and vegetables, as well as the right portions of proteins, carbs, and fats, are essential for your immune system
experts recommend at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise every week.
it is recommended to aim for a BMI of 25 and lower to keep your immune system working effectively.
set a sleep routine that gives you at least 6 hours of sleep and stick to it.
if you smoke, you can get support to help you stop.

p2.li: That being said, there is also evidence to suggest that excessive immunity can be harmful to your child. For children especially those below five years old, their immune system is highly inexperienced. Giving excess immunity boosters can harm a child’s body. An excessively strong immune system may start attacking the healthy cells in the body, thus damaging some organs.
Therefore, when it comes to giving your child an immunity shot, it is best to get the help of a certified dietician.
